tasks.task: Put on protective gear before handling farm equipment.
Approach the combine harvester to check its operations.
subtasks: Inspect visible components for any damage.
Turn the key to activate machine.
Drive the combine through the field.
Manage crop flow into the machine.
Use augers or elevators to transfer grain.

tasks.task: Perform routine maintenance checks on the combine harvester.

subtasks: Position the machine over the transport vehicle.
Begin grain flow removal manually or with auger.

tasks.task: Check fuel efficiency and make adjustments.
subtasks: Monitor how much fuel is consumed.
Adjust engine speed settings or use cruise control.
Consider aerodynamics or implement drag reduction.
Keep hands and clothing away from moving parts.
Monitor ground speed and work area.
Check blind spots when backing up.
Use mirrors and cameras for better visibility when moving.

tasks.task: Conduct final checks before shutting down.
subtasks: Verify that all safety systems are on.
Release PTO and fold any attachments.
Park in a level location and secure.
Perform a walk-around inspection for any leaks or damages.

tasks.task: Clean and store combine for next use.
subtasks: Brush off exterior of the machine.
Apply protective coatings or lubricants to moving parts.
Fill with appropriate fluids if necessary.

tasks.task: Perform routine maintenance checks on the combine harvester. Subtasks include inspecting fluid levels, checking oil, coolant, hydraulic systems, cleaning filters, lubricating parts, tightening belts.
MAINTASK: Unload the combine after harvest. Unload grain into a transport vehicle or storage, making sure everything is secure.
Check fuel efficiency and make adjustments. Monitoring fuel consumption and adjusting settings or behaviors to improve efficiency.
Ensure safety during operation. This would involve keeping hands and clothing away from moving parts, monitoring speed, checking blind spots, using signals, and ensuring good visibility.

Conduct final checks before shutting down. This includes turning off systems, parking safely, checking for damages, etc. Then, cleaning and storing it properly. Subtasks like brushing off exterior, cleaning windows, servicing filters, applying protective measures.

Manage grain transfer during harvesting. Then, during the harvest, they might also encounter issues that require adjusting the combine, like changing the cutter bar height or cleaning filters. So maybe those are part of the operational tasks.
Perform routine maintenance checks on the combine harvester.
Check fuel efficiency and make adjustments.
Put on protective gear before handling farm equipment.
subtasks: Choose appropriate safety gear (helmet, ear protection, gloves, boots)

tasks.task: Approach the combine harvester to check its operations.

subtasks: Monitor grain flow and periodically check grain tank level.
Use augers for transfer when necessary.

tasks.task: Perform routine maintenance checks on the combine harvester.
subtasks: Check fluid levels (oil, coolant, hydraulic fluid).
Adjust settings (e.g., engine speed) to reduce consumption.
Keep hands/arms away from moving parts.
Park in a safe, level location.
